snippet.title: Rev up for Bras and Bikes charity motorcycle ride
snippet.content: THE three-month countdown is on for the 2017 Bras and Bikes fundraising ride and now with their major sponsor on board, organisers are revving up for the big day. Girl Torque group leader Judy Noakes last week received the sponsorship cheque from Col Clarke, owner of TourOz Trikes in Yandina. Dressed appropriately for the occasion, Mr Clarke said he was delighted to be supporting the event, which is planned for October 29. "TourOz Trikes is thrilled to be on board with Girl Torque to raise valuable funds for Bloomhill Cancer Care," Mr Clarke said. "An event like this is a fantastic way to bring the community together and we hope it attracts hundreds of riders and support on the day." TourOz Trikes offer tour rides around the Sunshine Coast hinterland as well as hire trikes and trikes for sale. The popular vehicles come in two and three seater versions. Bras and Bikes is an annual fundraiser now in its 16th year. The event brings riders and pillions out in their hundreds with the requirement to wear a pink bra and create a colourful dedication to the cause, with all proceeds going towards Bloomhill Cancer Care in Buderim. Ms Noakes said while Girl Torque was a women's riding association, there were certain exceptions in the annual calendar where "the blokes are allowed to join in" and Bras and Bikes was one. Riders start and finish at the Yandina Bowls Club. Start time on the day is 7.30am, with a departure at 9.30am. Registration is just $20 per bike and can be bought online at http://www.bloomhill. com.au/online-shop This is how early you need to be at the airport now.
